question.title: Java AffineTransformOp.filter() Causes Weird Tearing in Tilemap on some devices
question.body:
so I'm trying to make a simple tile map in Java with Graphics. On my main device at home everything works perfectly well, yet on my Laptop, I get this weird tearing. It seems to be caused by AffineTransformOp.filter(), as when I remove it the tearing stops.

            for(int y = 0; y < this.game.level.height; y++) {
            for(int x = 0; x < this.game.level.width; x++) {
                AffineTransform tx = new AffineTransform();
                tx.rotate(this.game.level.tiles[x][y].rotation, Tile.tileSize / 2, Tile.tileSize / 2);
                AffineTransformOp op = new AffineTransformOp(tx, AffineTransformOp.TYPE_BILINEAR);
                g2.drawImage(op.filter(this.game.level.tiles[x][y].image, null),
                            (x * Tile.tileSize) - this.game.camera.x, 
                            (y * Tile.tileSize) - this.game.camera.y,
                            Tile.tileSize, Tile.tileSize, null);
            }

Tearing when Moving Diagonally :

The issue also does not seem to be anything to do with operating systems as both computers run Fedora 42 with the gnome window manager.
